summary: Wages must be paid at fixed intervals and within the time fixed by the employer.
snippet: Wages shall be paid on or before the expiry of the day following the last day of the wage-period.

summary: The Code consolidates wage rules; employers must pay wages and comply with minimum wage provisions.
snippet: Wages means all remuneration expressed in terms of money payable to a person employed.

summary: Employers who wrongfully withhold wages may be liable for penalties under the Act.
snippet: Penalty may be imposed where employer contravenes payment provisions of the Act.

summary: Code specifies payment intervals and employer obligations on timely wage disbursal.
snippet: Every employer shall pay wages to the employee in such manner as may be prescribed.

summary: The Act applies to specified establishments and classes of employed persons for wage regulation.
snippet: This Act applies to the whole of India and to specified classes of employed persons.

summary: Workers can approach labour authorities or courts for enforcement where wages are unpaid.
snippet: Disputes regarding wages may be referred to appropriate authority for remedy.

section: Chapter V - Reference to Industrial Tribunal
summary: Employees may challenge unfair dismissals and seek remedy via industrial dispute resolution mechanisms.
snippet: An industrial dispute may be referred to a Court or Tribunal for adjudication.

summary: Certain retrenchments require notice or compensation under the Act's provisions.
snippet: Retrenchment shall be carried out only after giving notice or wages in lieu and compensation.

summary: Acts by employers that unfairly dismiss or discriminate may be treated as unfair labour practices.
snippet: The Fifth Schedule lists unfair labour practices by employers and workmen.

summary: Individual service matters can be raised through prescribed dispute resolution routes.
snippet: Matters of service conditions may be provided for by law and adjudicated by Industrial Tribunals.

summary: Who is a 'workman' and covered categories are defined under the Act for redressal eligibility.
snippet: Definitions section explains 'workman' and applicability for industrial disputes.

summary: Orders of tribunals and courts provide remedies including reinstatement or compensation where justified.
snippet: Tribunal orders may include reinstatement or compensation when dismissal is unlawful.

law_name: Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (POSH) Act, 2013
summary: Employers must constitute Internal Complaints Committees to receive and redress harassment complaints.
snippet: Every employer shall constitute an Internal Complaints Committee in each office or district.

summary: The Act prescribes complaint filing timelines, inquiry procedures, and interim reliefs for victims.
snippet: Complaints must be in writing and the committee shall inquire into every complaint in accordance with rules.

summary: Employers must provide a safe working environment and display policies against sexual harassment.
snippet: Employer shall provide safe working environment and display the penal consequences of sexual harassment.

summary: Centralized portals exist for reporting POSH complaints to government authorities.
snippet: Complaints may also be filed on centralised SHe-Box portal for monitoring implementation.
confidence_notes: Central reporting portals; verify current portal URL for live demo.

summary: Committee may recommend interim measures like transfer or preventing contact pending inquiry.
snippet: The ICC may recommend interim relief to the aggrieved woman during inquiry.

summary: False or malicious complaints may attract penal consequences under rules if established.
snippet: False or malicious complaints may attract punishment as per rules once established.

summary: Employers and employees contribute to EPF; employees have entitlement to provident fund benefits.
snippet: Establishment shall comply with Employees' Provident Fund Scheme and contributions as prescribed.

summary: Employees who complete prescribed service are eligible for gratuity on termination or retirement.
snippet: An employee who has rendered continuous service of five years shall be eligible for gratuity on termination.

summary: ESI provides medical and cash benefits for insured employees meeting threshold conditions.
snippet: Employees covered under ESI are entitled to medical benefits as per scheme rules.
confidence_notes: EPFO scheme PDF used for reference; link to ESI ministry for ESI-specific docs.

summary: Statutory benefit disputes can be referred to authorities for remedy and enforcement.
snippet: Disputes on statutory benefits may be referred to authorities for remedy.

summary: Employees may file claims for recovery of unpaid provident fund contributions.
snippet: Applications may be made for recovery of dues under the Provident Fund scheme.

summary: Employers who fail to pay gratuity may face penalties and recovery proceedings.
snippet: Employers failing to pay gratuity are subject to penalties and recovery proceedings.

summary: Workers are entitled to extra wages when working beyond normal hours.
snippet: Where a worker works more than normal hours, he shall be entitled to extra wages for overtime.

summary: The Code prescribes normal working hours and overtime payment rules.
snippet: The Code provides for wages for overtime work at rates as prescribed.

summary: Factory rules give entitlement to extra wages for work beyond daily limits (example: nine hours).
snippet: If a worker works in a factory for more than nine hours in any day he is entitled to extra wages.

summary: State laws set normal hours and overtime limits specific to the state jurisdiction.
snippet: State shops and establishments rules limit hours and prescribe overtime compensation.
confidence_notes: State acts vary; use local act for production.

summary: Overtime payment methodology follows prescribed norms under wage legislation.
snippet: Calculation of overtime shall follow prescribed norms laid down in wage rules.

summary: Some states propose specific weekly/quarterly caps; verify state gazette for exact limits.
snippet: Draft rules may set weekly working hours to 48 and quarterly overtime caps (example).
